DOC.detailed_description: The Interrelationship Between Women 's Involvement In Decision Making In Labor And Their Perception Of The Labor Experience Labor one significant event woman 's life . The process outcome labor may long term effect way woman perceive parent role personal , emotional physical capability . Each woman arrive labor plan construct belief , expectation fantasy regard labor process outcome , drive different cultural value personal belief . The clinical reality always correlate emotional construct woman 's anticipated level involvement decision make labor . Discrepancy woman 's desire expect labor process happen actuality may substantial impact woman 's life way experience future birth . The main goal research investigate effect labor process woman examine question whether woman 's involvement decision make labor effect perceive labor process . The perceived labor process combination woman 's level engagement decision make labor , perceive level control labor process level satisfaction obstetric caregiver ( gynecologist midwife ) . The participant research project shall comprise 100 woman hospitalize two day immediately follow labor delivery maternity unit Hillel Yaffe hospital , give birth normal delivery , term ( 37 week gestation ) surgical instrumental intervention complication either baby . The participant give self-replying questionnaire construct especially purpose research project . The questionnaire comprise seven part : ( 1 ) social-demographic information , ( 2 ) health background , ( 3 ) obstetric background , ( 4 ) woman 's perspective labor process general , ( 5 ) woman 's perspective progression actual labor , ( 6 ) woman 's evaluation attitude obstetric caregiver ( gynecologist midwife ) ( 7 ) level control woman decision make labor perception labor experience . The research finding analyze statistically use Statistical Package Social Sciences ( SPSS ) format .
